pageContext.Title: HTML & CSS - Layouting
pageContext.Description: Being able to layout a website, i.e. to display elements in certain positions, is fundamental to front-end web development. When you make a design file or receive one from someone you should be able to imagine how to best use HTML and CSS to translate that static image file into a live web page. To exercise this skill, you will learn about all relevant features of CSS , namely the Box Model, Flexbox and CSS Grid.

Skills.Skill: Be able to create any layout with the tools available in CSS

actionPoints.actionPoint: Read tutorials on each of the listed topics
Create small, proof-of-concept, demos on a sandbox such as CodePen or Glitch
Re-create the cover of a website (or magazine? poster?) you like
Read-up on why developers are afraid of CSS "float"
Find what which one is better Flexbox or CSS Grid (spoiler alert: they complete each other)
